definition: doubts and suspicions/a maze of doubts/puzzle/mystery
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: You can not doubt your own existence.
sentences.chinese: 此種疑團，當不會如此長久存在。

sentences.english: When he read the letter, his doubts cleared away.
The doubt was still unsolved after his repeated explanations.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他一再解釋疑團仍然存在。

sentences.english: There are, however, still some puzzles to be uncoiled.
sentences.chinese: 但是還有一些疑團沒有解決。

sentences.english: As the mists cleared from my brain, I latched on to their conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我腦中的疑團消釋了，便注意地聽他們交談。

sentences.english: A sudden doubt came to my mind.
He cleared up the question of his absence in the presence of all his classmates.
sentences.chinese: 他當着全班同學的面澄清了他缺席的疑團。

sentences.english: Can ravel out what's in my head．
sentences.chinese: 定能解開我頭腦中的疑團。

sentences.english: And I don't know how to see my way through.
sentences.chinese: 我也不知道該如何解開這些疑團。

definition: loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: the critical moment/life and death crisis
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
